{{Infobox Company |company_name = PeopleSmart.com |company logo = |company type = Private |foundation = 2006 |location = Redwood City, California |key_people = Matthew Monahan and Brian Monahan |industry = Public Records Search |products = PeopleSmart.com |revenue = |num_employees = |parent = |homepage = http://www.peoplesmart.com }}
'''PeopleSmart.com''' is a people [[search engine]] developed by the [[Redwood City, CA]]-based technology company [[Inflection (company)|Inflection]].<ref name="PS1">{{cite web |url=http://www.peoplesmart.com/about |title=About Us |date= |author= |publisher=PeopleSmart.com |accessdate=May 1, 2013}}</ref><ref name="WSJ">{{cite web |url=http://blogs.wsj.com/venturecapital/2010/09/02/inflection-lands-big-first-round-for-public-records-search/ |title=Inflection Lands Big First Round For Public Records Search |date=September 2, 2010 |author=Tomio Geron |publisher=The Wall Street Journal |accessdate=May 1, 2013}}</ref> The website is recognized for providing users with access to contact information and [[public records]] directories.<ref name="BJ">{{cite web |url=http://www.bizjournals.com/sanjose/print-edition/2011/11/18/inflection-sees-big-opportunities-in.html |title=Inflection sees big opportunities in Big Data |date=November 18, 2011 |author=Jon Xavier |publisher=Silicon Valley Business Journal|accessdate=May 1, 2013}}</ref><ref name="PR">{{cite web |url=http://inflection.com/products/peoplesmart.html |title=Changing The Face of People Search |date= |author= |publisher=Inflection |accessdate=May 1, 2013}}</ref> PeopleSmart.com has been featured in [[The New York Times]], [[VentureBeat]], [[TechCrunch]], and [[The Wall Street Journal]].<ref name="VB">{{cite web |url=http://venturebeat.com/2010/09/01/inflection-brothers-funding/ |title=Bootstrapping band of brothers raise $30M for people search engine Inflection |date=September 1, 2010 |author=Matthew Lynley |publisher=VentureBeat |accessdate=May 1, 2013}}</ref><ref name="CB"/><ref name="WSJ"/>
==History== PeopleSmart.com’s parent company, Inflection, was founded in 2006 by brothers Matthew and Brian Monahan.<ref name="THC">{{cite web |url=http://www.thecrimson.com/article/2011/3/24/monahan-inflection-sundquist-college/ |title=Startup Aims to Digitize Records |date=March 24, 2011 |author=Matthew T. Lowe |publisher=The Harvard Crimson |accessdate=May 1, 2013}}</ref><ref name="CB">{{cite web |url=http://www.crunchbase.com/company/inflection |title=Inflection |date= |author= |publisher=Crunchbase |accessdate=May 1, 2013}}</ref> After spending 4 years developing the technology platform to support the site, the pair founded PeopleSmart.com in September 2010.<ref name="AU">{{cite web |url=http://inflection.com/about/ |title=About Us |date= |author= |publisher=Inflection |accessdate=May 1, 2013}}</ref> Inflection raised $30 million in a Series A round of [[venture financing]] that same year.<ref name="XE">{{cite web |url=http://www.xconomy.com/san-francisco/2010/09/02/inflection-gets-30m-launches-peoplesmart/ |title=Inflection Gets $30M, Launches PeopleSmart |date=September 2, 2010 |author=Wade Roush |publisher=Xconoomy |accessdate=May 1, 2013}}</ref>
==Services== PeopleSmart.com aggregates contact information, social profiles, and public documents about people.<ref name="AU"/><ref name="WSJ"/> The website is built atop a proprietary big-data platform called STORM.<ref name="PR"/> Users of the website are able to acquire information either as one-time purchases or through a subscription.<ref name="PR"/>
PeopleSmart is marketed as a “friendly” people search engine because of its focus on privacy protection and data quality.<ref name="AU"/><ref name="PS1"/> Users are able to manage or remove their information on PeopleSmart as they choose.<ref name="WSJ"/>
==External Links== [http://www.inflection.com Inflection.com]
[http://www.peoplesmart.com Peoplesmart.com]
[http://www.identity.com Identity.com]
